item.title: Chumash Casino Resort’s ‘Project Pink’ Campaign Raises $10,083
item.description: SANTA YNEZ, CA – The Santa Ynez Band of Chumash Indians presented a check for $10,083 to the Breast Imaging Center at Goleta Valley Cottage Hospital to help the non-profit deliver superior care to its patients through ultrasound screenings, mammography and biopsies. The donation is part of the Chumash Casino Resort’s annual ‘Project Pink’ campaign, which showcases expertly crafted pink food and beverage creations, all in honor of Breast Cancer Awareness Month.
item.source:markdown: SANTA YNEZ, CA – The Santa Ynez Band of Chumash Indians presented a check for $10,083 to the Breast Imaging Center at Goleta Valley Cottage Hospital to help the non-profit deliver superior care to its patients through ultrasound screenings, mammography and biopsies. The donation is part of the Chumash Casino Resort’s annual ‘Project Pink’ campaign, which showcases expertly crafted pink food and beverage creations, all in honor of Breast Cancer Awareness Month.

item.title: Vandenberg Hosts Base Tour for San Luis Obispo Chamber of Commerce
item.description: Vandenberg Hosts Base Tour for San Luis Obispo Chamber of Commerce at Vandenberg Space Force Base, Calif., Dec. 19, 2025. The tour group was introduced to numerous facilities on base including the Space Launch Delta 30 headquarters building, Remote Launch Control Center, Pacific Coast Club, and Firefly Aerospace located at SLC-2. The tour provided details on Vandenberg’s various commercial partnerships, emphasizing its critical role in maintaining national strategic advantages in space.
item.source:markdown:
Vandenberg Hosts Base Tour for San Luis Obispo Chamber of Commerce at Vandenberg Space Force Base, Calif., Dec. 19, 2025. The tour group was introduced to numerous facilities on base including the Space Launch Delta 30 headquarters building, Remote Launch Control Center, Pacific Coast Club, and Firefly Aerospace located at SLC-2. The tour provided details on Vandenberg’s various commercial partnerships, emphasizing its critical role in maintaining national strategic advantages in space.
![Members of the San Luis Obispo Chamber of Commerce stand together for a group photo inside Space Launch Complex 2.](https://media.defense.gov/2025/Dec/22/2003848506/300/300/0/251219-X-DW038-1005.JPG)

item.title: Meet VSFB's 2025 Guardian Arena Teams
item.description: Teams will represent Vandenberg SFB at this year's Guardian Arena competition at Patrick Space Force Base, FL, Dec. 8-9. Guardians and Airmen from Vandenberg Space Force Base prepare to compete in the 3rd Annual Guardian Arena Challenge, held at Patrick Space Force Base, FLA, Dec. 8-9. Vandenberg teams, "Sidetrack'd," "Houston, We Have Two Kevin's (and Clay)," "Flying Tiger," and "CSpoc-alypse," will join 35 teams from across the Space Force to showcase their tactical proficiency, physical fitness, and mental resilience. The event highlights the "Guardian Spirit" in a service-level competition, bringing together participants from Field Commands, Space Base Delta, Space Launch Delta, and Space Delta to vie for the title of the most elite team of Guardians.
item.source:markdown:
Teams will represent Vandenberg SFB at this year's Guardian Arena competition at Patrick Space Force Base, FL, Dec. 8-9.

Vandenberg teams, "Sidetrack'd," "Houston, We Have Two Kevin's (and Clay)," "Flying Tiger," and "CSpoc-alypse," will join 35 teams from across the Space Force to showcase their tactical proficiency, physical fitness, and mental resilience.
The event highlights the "Guardian Spirit" in a service-level competition, bringing together participants from Field Commands, Space Base Delta, Space Launch Delta, and Space Delta to vie for the title of the most elite team of Guardians.
